snippet: Dennis Ferrara of Brooklyn, a Transportation Department employee, provides the authentic New York voice for many “accessible pedestrian signals” aiding the visually impaired.
abstract: Dennis Ferrara, supervisor electrician for New York City's Transportation Department, provides the audio recording at 15 intersections for the department’s so-called accessible pedestrian signals, designed to help people with limited sight cross the street safely; New Yorkers have become increasingly acquainted with his voice and its distinctive local flavor.
lead_paragraph: Dennis Ferrara of Brooklyn, a Transportation Department employee, provides the authentic New York voice for many “accessible pedestrian signals” aiding the visually impaired.

headline.seo: A New York Voice at New York Intersections
headline.main: A Voice of New York’s Streets, Saying That It’s Safe to Wawk
headline.print_headline: A Voice of New York’s Streets, Saying That It’s Safe to Wawk
